2018-12-16 12:14:06 [Pool]      [komodo] (Thread 2) getblocktemplate call failed for daemon instance 0 with error {"code":-9,"message":"Cannot get a block template while no peers are connected or chain not in sync!"}

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: last time i asked you which block height you are at, you posted `1142784`. that means you should be in sync.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the message you are posting is not from komodo daemon, but the pool software itseld. you need to make sure you have set up your pool properly. if not, ask for help from other pool operators. they can help you./

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you can post the output of `./komodo-cli getinfo`, that could help understanding your wallet issues

Content:
Aussie miners, I'd like to introduce https://minethechains.com/ 
This pool provides easy to switch KMD & Pirate mining(just change the port), with more KMD assetchains being added soon!
Please consider us if you'd like a low latency connection(compared to pools hosted in NA or EU). We offer a 1% fee and quick payouts (~3mins for ARRR & ~10mins for KMD).
The website is currently in construction, and if you join, have any feedback, or request a specific assetchain to be added, please let me know.

Author: skyguynca#0562
Content: Hey guys, I have had a private pool for about a month, it is doing good. I had some problems but I believe they are all worked out. It is just a basic S-NOMP pool, still the included pages from the download. I am looking for some  asic miners to come and try it out, give it a good testing. Today just concentrating on KMD and looking for some of you to jump on and load it with hashing power. 1% fee to  cover the server and you get everything else you earn. I provide all testers with my contact info including text number if you need to contact me while you are testing. Plus i will be monitoring my PM on the discord. Please come and help me test and let's make some coin,  I have not gotten a URL yet so still using ip address+port for main page. There you will get the coins and ports for mining. Please behave yourself I will ban all IP's immeadiately attempting to poke around where you don't belong. PM me for details,  Thanks David

Author: skyguynca#0562
Content: well that was a bust, thanks everyone for participating.....now on to the problem ok, so something is dreadfully wrong. on the 12, 13, 14th DEC I was averaging 25 blocks a day KMD, that is 25 x 2.97 = 74.25 KMD a day in block rewards. Have screen shot can show you. 15th did sapling upgrade and not a single block since. I figured I missed something or messed something up. So I completely wiped the server and reinstalled all the daemons. I let all of them sync, KMD - ZEC -ZCL all done but ZEN is still working on it...22 hours later. Anyway for the past 5 hours myself and a friend put all our asics on KMD, mined hard at 600k+ kh/s.....we should have blocked in under 3 hours, we let it go to 4 hours and 15 minutes ......no blocks at all, The diff was only 720k and we have over 900k in shares when we gave up. ......help me out please, something changed drastically with the sapling upgrade and my pool is not mining KMD now.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you need a pool that works with sapling

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the answer will be in debug.log when the pool tries to submit a block

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: You may have a pool configuration issue too, it could be loads of things. You've given us no technical information about your problem, I.e, pool outputs, debug.log outputs from the daemon. That info would be handy to help out

Author: skyguynca#0562
Content: no pool outputs out of the usual, nothing to show that it ever found a block and rejected it........just never found a block. Before I did the sapling update I was finding blocks np. in 9 hours usually 19-25 blocks, after the update nothing at all, I could mine with all 300kh/s for 24 hours and nothing. I am sure it is a setting or a problem with the daemon itself, if I had something to show then I would not have to ask what could be the problem.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`what are your tips and tricks or some hacks :pirate~1: for better mining efficiency ?`
1) don't use a GPU

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: 2) Overclocking is only a gain if you test rages (ironically, some modern GPUs are actually more efficient if you __under__clock them)

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: 3) If you live in the US (many other countries already use 200+) - run at 220v and not 110v (the power curve is less efficient on standard "110" [which is actually 115-120- but I digress])

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: that a good point about the 220v.

Author: gzezo#2697
Content: Agree, we have 220v here by default. Overall I am trying to figure out what is the most efficient things to focus on, if on contacting power plant owners, some software,firmware hacks or what

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
honestly, all of the above
If you're big enough to be contacting power co, then imo nothing should be running "stock" settings
But that's also kind of a "coin-flip" depending on *how big* (past a certain point customization man-hours are a wash to the write-off of any "losses" of not doing so)
